channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Fake videos from Russian propagandists aim to raise tensions ahead of Election Day
item.description: Intelligence officials say the video, which purported to show a Haitian immigrant claiming he had voted multiple times in Georgia, is the product of a Russian propaganda operation.
item.content:encoded:
Intelligence officials say the video, which purported to show a Haitian immigrant claiming he had voted multiple times in Georgia, is the product of a Russian propaganda operation.

(Image credit: Megan Varner)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Supreme Court sides with Democrats in Pennsylvania voting case
item.description: It is hard to estimate how many ballots will be affected by the decision or whether it will ultimately impact the outcome of the presidential election.
item.content:encoded:
It is hard to estimate how many ballots will be affected by the decision or whether it will ultimately impact the outcome of the presidential election.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Pushed by public opinion shift, Democrats adopt immigration restrictions
item.description: President Biden has issued a number of immigration-related executive actions that mimic those of the Trump administration, and VP Harris has promised she’ll continue restrictive policies.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden has issued a number of immigration-related executive actions that mimic those of the Trump administration, and VP Harris has promised she’ll continue restrictive policies.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: An 'unprecedented' good news story about a potentially deadly viral outbreak
item.description: The death rate for Marburg virus is nearly 90%. There are no approved vaccines and treatments. So how did Rwanda achieve what one doctor calls an "unprecedented" success in controlling its outbreak?
item.content:encoded:
The death rate for Marburg virus is nearly 90%. There are no approved vaccines and treatments. So how did Rwanda achieve what one doctor calls an "unprecedented" success in controlling its outbreak?

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Are Countries Ignoring the Laws of War?
item.description: There are rules and norms in place in conflicts meant to shield civilians from the worst harms of war. But human rights groups say lately they're being ignored or broken. Our correspondent has been covering two wars in which many of the laws of war are being flouted.
item.content:encoded: There are rules and norms in place in conflicts meant to shield civilians from the worst harms of war. But human rights groups say lately they're being ignored or broken. Our correspondent has been covering two wars in which many of the laws of war are being flouted.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: A warden faced discipline over abuse at a prison. Now he runs a prison training site
item.description: Investigators said warden Andrew Ciolli should have stopped abuse of prisoners. He faced disciplinary action. Now he's the director of a federal center that teaches others how to run prisons.
item.content:encoded: Investigators said warden Andrew Ciolli should have stopped abuse of prisoners. He faced disciplinary action. Now he's the director of a federal center that teaches others how to run prisons.
item.dc:creator: Christie Thompson

item.title: Employers added only 12,000 jobs in October. That seems bad -- but there's a catch
item.description: U.S. employers added just 12,000 jobs last month — but the number was depressed by a machinists' strike at Boeing and Hurricanes Helene and Milton.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. employers added just 12,000 jobs last month — but the number was depressed by a machinists' strike at Boeing and Hurricanes Helene and Milton.

(Image credit: David Ryder)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Here’s where Trump and Harris stand on 5 issues affecting workers
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump have both appealed to workers in this year's election. But the candidates’ stances on many issues affecting workers remain far apart.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump have both appealed to workers in this year's election. But the candidates’ stances on many issues affecting workers remain far apart.

(Image credit: Mario Tama/Getty Images; Win McNamee/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Here's what life is like in a city in the grip of Sudan’s brutal war
item.description: The Sudanese city of Omdurman lives in the shadow of war, facing daily shelling and battered medical services. But some people are trying to eke out a return to life, however precarious.
item.content:encoded:
The Sudanese city of Omdurman lives in the shadow of war, facing daily shelling and battered medical services. But some people are trying to eke out a return to life, however precarious.

(Image credit: Luke Dray for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Trump visits Dearborn, a hub for Arab Americans, in a last-minute bid to sway voters
item.description: Former President Trump stopped in Dearborn, Michigan — a city where a majority of people are Arab American — largely without addressing concerns about the war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Trump stopped in Dearborn, Michigan — a city where a majority of people are Arab American — largely without addressing concerns about the war in Gaza.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo
